column4: my sound stopped working from upgrade to 9.10 from 9.04; any solution?
Ok many people have  had issues after upgrading 9.04 to 9.10.  A good idea would be to try a clean install.
not an option
Why not?
no place to backup all files (no more space)
Buy an external hard disk maybe, or  use  Ubuntu One?
!caps |  Sassinak__
is it a problem in pulse, can i compile it from src
probably, but probably not the best idea also
I can't really help with sound
!sound | soundstopped
i can't even access the sound controls (won't load)
!ubuntuone |  soundstopped
!one
oh no factoid for it or whatever, well anyway as I said you could back up your data with it
i get the error "waiting for sound system to respond"
for major problems on stable releases, the ideal solution is not always to wipe everything and start again with a fresh install
sure, but 9.10 isn't that stable really, by the sounds of things

plus if you stick around here long enough  more 9.10 upgrade issues and such
